extension.dc:title: GGBN Gel Image Extension
extension.name: GelImage
extension.dc:description: Support for gel image properties as an extension to an Material Sample core. Intended to be a one to many relation to the Material Sample core.

property.name: identifier
property.dc:description: The public URL that identifies and locates the media file directly, not the html page it might be shown on. Link to a DNA sample image (e.g. agarose gel image); used to determine fragment length profile

property.name: DNAThreshold
property.dc:description: Fragment size of the ladder you choose as a standard to measure the percentage of your DNA size, at or above threshold fragment size from ladder
property.examples: The hindIII ladder has fragment sizes (in base-pairs, bp): 564; 2,027; 2,322; 4,361, 6,557; 9,416; 23,130

property.name: gelBuffer
property.dc:description: Buffer used to make your gel and buffer in which you run the gel. The gel should be made with the same buffer in which it is run

property.name: gelLadder
property.dc:description: A Gel Ladder is a combination of various known-length fragments of DNA or RNA used to measure DNA or RNA fragments of unknown lengths

property.name: gelStain
property.dc:description: Type of gel stain used. Gel stain is a substance that binds to DNA and fluoresces under ultraviolet (UV) light

property.name: gelStainConcentration
property.examples: 5ul of 10,000x into 50 ml of TBE buffer

property.name: stainingMethod
property.dc:description: Method used for staining gels, either precast-adding stain to your gel before casting; post stain-staining your gel after running; stain in loading buffer-adding the stain to the loading buffer
property.examples: Precast stain; Post stain; Stain in loading buffer

property.name: percentAboveThreshold
property.dc:description: Percent of your DNA at or above the size of the threshold
property.examples: 10%, 35%, 50%, 80%. Usually a protocol considers 50% of fragments â‰¥ 9KB to be high genomic quality
